March 19, 1951
Mr* Graydon Ausmus
WUOA, University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
I appreciate your letter of March 14* Perhaps we can
get Dick Hull to dictate a paragraph or two on the history
of NAEB, by copy of this letter. You should hear directly
from him.
You are perfectly correct about the necessity of turning
out an authoritative list of member stations, associate members,
etc. All of us have been running into all sorts of difficulties,
because there is an apparent discrepancy between Mr. Griffith’s
list, Paulu’s list, and information which is available from the
F.C.C. and the BROADCASTING YEARBOOK.
I hope to return the material on the brochure to you within
the next few days. I realize I am holding up the works, but I
want to be sure that the material is everything it should be.
You are doing a swell job in working toward an over-all
membership campaign. I hope that we will have a report at the
May 1 meeting in Columbus.
With all best wishes, I am
DIRECTOR OF STUDIES SITS SaS
